Welcome

A good web developer needs a good text editor or an IDE. Here are a number of options you can chose from. All of the following are available on both Mac and Windows, unless otherwise stated.

Aptana Studio 3

Visit

Aptana Studio 3 is a professional IDE. It features HTML, CSS and JavaScript code assist, The IDE also provides wizards for deployment to Heroku or Engine Yard, as well as support for FTP clients. It brings along an integrated terminal and a debugger as well as git integration for version control

Atom

Visit

Atom is a text editor developed in Electron. Atom is a lightweight cross platform. It's highly extensible with a built in package manager. Atom also provides multiple panes and autocompletion to help improve your productivity.

Brackets

Visit

Brackets is an Electron app designed for web development. It is lightweight and modern, yet powerful and extensible. Brackets gives you options such as split-screen coding and a live browser preview.

Sublime Text

Visit

Sublime is one of the most popular text editors available. Written in C++, it is very fast. Sublime comes with thousands of extensions you can install as you desire. Sublime is free for use but it's creator does ask for a one time payment.

Webstorm

Visit

Created by JetBrains, the same people behind Pycharm, Webstorm is a powerful JavaScript IDE. Webstorm has powerful code completion, on-the-fly error detection and refactoring tools for JavaScript, Typescript, stylesheet languages and the top frameworks such as Vue, React and Angular. But you better bust out the wallet, Webstorm is about $169.

VS Code

Visit

VS Code is lightweight and powerful and my personal favorite. It is highly extensible with thousands of plug ins to chose from. The syntax highlighting is consistent. It integrates wellw with ESLint, pointing out errors and offering suggestions and it comes with an integrated terminal that allows you to run your build tools right inside the editor. Built by Microsoft using Electron, VS Code is free.
